If you want to come into the stadium, respect others that are there and remember to social distance or wear your mask.

Thank you,
Coach Wiley

Good afternoon, AISD families! Today we are kicking off our Ready...Set...Read! summer reading challenge. Beginning today and extending through Friday, July 31, you can begin logging books that you read at home that will win you a free t-shirt and could win you a Chromebook! To participate, collect a summer reading challenge flyer either from the elementary office or by printing the flyer attached below. Log the 12 books that you read over the summer. Return it by mail or in person to the elementary office by Friday, July 31 for a chance to be entered into our Chromebook drawing. One entry per student, please. This is open to all AISD students PreK - 12th grade. Teachers are encouraged to participate, as well!

We find this more critically important now than ever before with all we have seen over the last few months with remote learning. Dr. Seuss gives us this great reminder, "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go!"

FROM AISD SUPERINTENDENT AARON WALDRIIP.......

COVID-19 Grading Policy Update
For transcript purposes, GPA calculations will cease at the end of the 4th six weeks.

Numerical grades for any students taking high school credit for transcript purposes, will be recorded as follows:
First semester grades will stand as recorded.
The second semester grade will be determined by averaging the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th six weeks grades. ((1st + 2nd + 3rd + 4th) / 4 = 2nd semester average)

During remote learning, secondary students (6th-12th) will be graded on a Pass/Fail system.

Elementary students (Pre-K-5th) will have four grades that may be assigned: E - Excellent, S - Satisfactory, N - Needs Improvement, U - Unsatisfactory.

Grade reports will be mailed home near the end of the semester.

Teachers and principals will communicate missing work through Google classroom and or phone calls.
